intro: Orthaea ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian orthaea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Orthaea ecuadorensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as cloud forests and mountainous areas.
